item.description:
Every month the Wadsworth Atheneum schedules a movie to end its First Thursday evening. In March it will be "The Cotton Club", the film from 1984 that brings to life the famous Harlem jazz club and the people that visited it and those that ran it.   127 min. Rated R. Directed by Francis Ford Coppola. Starring Gregory Hines, Richard Gere, and Diane Lane.  Read the Roger Ebert review and check http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0087089/

I set the start time at the time I am likely to head for the Aetna Theatre lobby. Feel free to come earlier to enjoy First Thursday! It starts at 5:00pm, costs just $5 (including the film) and is free to members, students with current ID, or for April to anybody who is wearing GREEN! Check out the Wadsworth's calendar pages to find out the details of the April activities.

group.name: Beyond the Multiplex: Hartford's Indie and Foreign Film fans

item.name: "The Cotton Club" @ First Thursday
